answers.author: Christopher Layton
answers.text:
In Duck we completed an amphitheater project in 2009.  The project was a part of an overall master plan effort for our park property.  The committee that developed the plan was comprised of citizens appointed by the Council who worked with a consulting group and staff to build consensus through surveys and charettes.  The amphitheater itself was constructed through grant funds and general fund dollars and Town event staff schedules its use throughout the year.  Please contact me at clayton@townofduck.com or at 252-255-1234 for more information.

Hi Toni,
I'm originally from Raleigh, NC, and the city just completed its downtown amphitheater  in June of 2010.  The project was funded by $2.6 million in public money.  For a short time, the city considered allowing Bud Light to sponsor the project and receive naming rights, in exchange for a large portion of that funding.  However, NC State law forbids naming any public venue after an alcoholic beverage, so Bud Light remains an event sponsor but did not sponsor construction.
Acts are booked through an agreement with Live Nation, and the season runs from April to October.

author: Toni Shope
text:
An Alliance member is interested in finding out more information about how other governments whether or not to have an entertainment venue like an amphitheater.  
They are interested in finding out:
1)  What prompted the amphitheater to be built?  
a.  Were there many requests for events, etc.?
b.  Was there a study done by an outside organization that found it was needed or wanted?
i.  If so, what organization did the study?
2)  What was the planning process behind having it built?
a.  Funding
b.  Business Plan
c.  Events Schedule
3)  Who schedules the events?
a.  How are the groups/events selected?
4)  Any additional information that relates to the decision-making process or current plans for the amphitheater
The biggest question is if there was a study done by an organization and if so, who did that for them. 
Thank you,
title: Entertainment Venue/Amphitheater
